item.title: Explore Napa's Hidden Lovall Valley
item.description:
Explore Napa's Hidden Lovall Valley

Want to spend a few hours cycling in an idyllic setting? Take a spin through Napa's Lovall Valley, where you'll find rolling vineyards, architecturally interesting homes, and roadside art set in a compact bowl of verdant green hills.

item.title: Ask a Somm: When Should I Decant Wine?
item.description:
Ask a Somm: When Should I Decant Wine?

Back before the days of Roy Choi and Michael Voltaggio, Los Angeles was home to chefs like Wolfgang Puck, Nancy Silverton, and Josiah Citrin - the city's old guard. Perhaps retaining some of L.A.'s original DNA, those latter chefs have mostly stayed true to proper white tablecloth dining, a nearly extinct species among the city's influx of fermentation and bowls of raw fish.

item.title: 2016 Bud Break - Earliest Ever? Napa Valley growing season begins
item.description:
2016 Bud Break - Earliest Ever? Napa Valley growing season begins

With the combination of warm temperatures and relatively little recent rain, bud break has begun in Napa Valley, marking the beginning of the winegrape growing season. "Buds on chardonnay have begun swelling and bursting on a few vines.

item.title: Yountville: K. Laz offers rarefied tastings
item.description:
Yountville: K. Laz offers rarefied tastings

"Inaccessible" doesn't seem to have a place in K. Laz Wine Collection owner Kerrin Laz's vocabulary. With the debut of her posh tasting room in downtown Yountville this past fall, she's seeking to share the wealth, offering by-appointment, private sit-down samplings of treasures like the nearly impossible-to-find 2012 Screaming Eagle Second Flight ($635), and the forthcoming Screaming Eagle Cabernet Sauvignon 2013 (price TBD), expected to be released in March.

item.title: Spring/Summer 2016: At Thomas Keller's Addendum
item.description:
Spring/Summer 2016: At Thomas Keller's Addendum

Everything changes and nothing stands still. ~Heraclitus We have a time change coming up. A week later, we officially transition from Winter into Spring. Before all that change happens, however, something much, much tastier will take place.

item.title: How To Make Your Own Beef Jerky
item.description:
How To Make Your Own Beef Jerky

All you need is an oven, a hunk of meat, and a few secret seasoning blends. From there, it's easy if you follow O'Sullivan's five steps. 1. Go Shopping Buy a 2-pound piece of top round steak, and ask the person behind the counter to trim off any visible fat and silver skin.

item.title: Will the Peel P50 top $100,000?
item.description:
Will the Peel P50 top $100,000?

The Peel P50 is better known as that car that Jeremy Clarkson once drove inside the BBC building. What was not made abundantly clear in that memorable "Top Gear UK" episode was just how rare and valuable the P50 happens to be.

item.title: Finalists Announced For The 2016 S.Pellegrino Almost Famous Chef Competition
item.description:
Finalists Announced For The 2016 S.Pellegrino Almost Famous Chef Competition

item.title: Get to Know a New Side of Tempranillo
item.description:
Get to Know a New Side of Tempranillo

Tempranillo is Spain's second most planted grape, after the the lesser-known air√©n, and it is the country's signature varietal wine-one that's a crowd-pleaser, yet also age-worthy and collectable. According to Australian economics professor Kym Anderson, global Tempranillo plantings have boomed, increasing almost fivefold between 1990 and 2010, bringing tempranillo from the world's 24th most planted grape to the fourth.

item.title: Bacon Bacon's SoMa cafe, located near the ballpark, opens next week
item.description:
Bacon Bacon's SoMa cafe, located near the ballpark, opens next week

Attention bacon lovers: Just in time for the start of baseball season, Bacon Bacon's Third Street cafe is set to open this coming Monday, February 29. The tiny ten seat cafe, which is located just steps from the ballpark, marks the second brick-and-mortar spot for Jim Angelus's fleet of super popular bacon-fueled food trucks.
